divs: sighting detailsi was inside on the computer when i recieved a call from son in law who lives 6 blocks away told me to rush outside and by looking towards kingman which is to our southeast, i would see a ufo. well i checked and sure enough it was right there, about 1\8 the size of a full moon. seemingly over kingman, az but impossible to judge actual size or distance could have actually been over flagstaff. i immediatly rushed in to grab a very cheap small pair of binoculars i own to verify it. i could barely identify bright lights on object. i then ran across to my neighbors knowing she owns some decent binoculars. i pointed out the object to her and she ran for her pair which we both used to confirm the object was in fact a ufo. at first i was somewhat taken aback but felt comfortable knowing she was confirming the sighting. she described it as shaped like a halloween acorn candy (yellow orange ones). it was as if it was emiting a bright white light from what i felt may have been the bottom of the craft. after discussing the object for a moment or two she decided we needed more witnesses as noone else that we could see on the block was witnessing this. she ran in to call her husband (a real skeptic as i found out), when he came out he immediately dismissed it as a star and we both noticed it had suddenly diminished in size, and as he walked away and laughed it off, it completely disappeared. it did momentarily come back as a small object and then a mass of cloud covering moved in.
trends: There have been 35 other sightings in Kingman
There were no other sightings in Kingman on or around May 18th 2009
Summary: bright as full moon upside down triangle stationary
